pros: Love it here and the environment

pros: Had amazing team work on my floor. Used to have a set schedule but is becoming unpredictable.
cons: Staff is constantly pulled to another floor due to low staffing throughout hospital. Hospital is attempting to stop using agency but there are not enough staff nurses to do this. Patients have high acuity of care needed and nurses are usually maxed out at 6 patients and struggle to provide the care needed. Psych patients are mixed with regular patients and it is very taxing. Burn out.

review_title: Bedside nurse 9 years on night shift.  Challenging, but rewarding.  Day shift nurse about 10 months --
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Tifton, GA
pros: The best of benefits for personal well being can be found with this organization.  The hospital management and staff  were very helpful and encouraging when times got  tough out there on the floor doing patient bedside care.
cons: The new computer system is very difficult to use.  And nursing staff are scheduled to work every other weekend.  This has been policy for as long as I can remember.

review_title: Go somewhere else for your care!  The new kids on the block know nothing(nurses).
pros: I made $26.00/hr. You work three days per week. That's all you take of that. Constant call outs because the nurses think they will be called off. A bunch of fake, mean, users. There are no advantages to working for TRMC. The charge nurse will go on Paragon & attempt to look up your family medical history.
cons: Not enough staff(nurse extenders). RNs who think they aren't supposed to give direct care. Your given the worst patients, but I survived!! Throw paragon in the garbage, it's a stupid EMR. Whoever built it should be terminated.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Cordele, GA
pros: Flexibility in work schedule, I was part time off site and had no problem working around my kids' school and activities schedules.
cons: The way performance reviews are set up makes it hard to get your full raise. I also had problems with my supervisor setting my goals for me instead of me being able to set my own for the review process, which is how it was meant to be done. The way she did it, it made it very hard to get my entire raise because she knew that the wording of the goal made it hard to meet it.

pros: Wonderful people, very friendly, administration is approachable. Great benefits, family-oriented. Open to new ideas vs the old way of how things used to be done in the organization. Not afraid to fail and try again.
cons: Staffing levels. It takes too long to get someone hired. Too many meetings and not enough time for the "doing."

pros: The employees including Senior Leadership truly care about our patients, employees, and community.  There are challenges within any healthcare systems, but TRHS works very hard to share real time information with all employees to enhance the employee experience and drive engagement.
cons: Location - we are in a small town in South Georgia so it is hard to reach the masses to let them know about all the great things TRHS has to offer and has accomplished.

pros: Great place for a new graduate to learn the basics of bed side nursing. Pay is ok for a new graduate nurse.
cons: Not enough staff on a daily basis. Patient nurse ratio is too high which causes burnout. Floors need to be fully staffed with extenders every shift,

pros: I washed the dishes and also washed the pots and pans and put them up and I also took out the trash and mopped the floors before my shift ended!
cons: I was discharged for something that I didn't know about at the time and I am appealing that decision as we speak!

job_title: Unit Secretary/Nurse Extender in Tifton, GA
pros: Great for learning considering they are always short handed. Insurance was good. Pharmacy benefits were a plus.
cons: Not enough staff. Management isn't supportive. Pay needs to be better. No room for movement to different areas. Expect you to follow rules while Mgt. and back office doesn't have to. They threatened our jobs on a daily basis for numbers and percentages on surveys, but took away from the patients so we all suffered and they kept all their pay.

job_title: Secretary PT Department Reg in Tifton, GA
